title._content: A photograph shows the area of the Confederate assault on Cemetery Hill not long after the Union battery repulsed the fierce attack by the Louisiana Tigers (LOC)

description._content: Scene of the charge of the Louisiana Tigers. View taken from Cemetery Hill at about position of right gun of Wiedrich's (i. e. Weidrich's) Battery [photographed 1863 July, printed between 1880 and 1889] 1 photographic print on card mount : albumen. Notes: Photo is the left half of a two-part panorama by an unidentified photographer. The right half is at the National Archives. (Source: Frassanito, p. 101) Title from item. Photo shows the site where confederate infantry commanded by Brigadier General H.S. Hays (the Lousiana Tigers) charged against Union batteries on Cemetery Hill on the evening of July 2nd and broke through the Northern defensive line before a Union counterattack pushed them back. The German Reformed Church is in background. (Source: Frassanito, p. 100) Gift; Col. Godwin Ordway; 1948. Published in: Gettysburg: A Journey in Time, by William A. Frassanito, 1975, p. 100-102. Subjects: United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865. United States--Pennsylvania--Gettysburg. Format: Albumen prints--1860-1870. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.32846 Call Number: LOT 4167-A, no. 20
